titleStmt.title: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
titleStmt.author: William Shakespeare

respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castItem.roleDesc: surnamed Bolingbroke, Duke of Hereford, son to John of Gaunt; afterwards King Henry IV
son to the Duke of York

castItem.role: Captain of a band of Welshmen

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter KING RICHARD, JOHN OF GAUNT, with other Nobles and Attendants.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter JOHN OF GAUNT with the DUCHESS OF GLOUCESTER.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter the Lord Marshal and the DUKE OF AUMERLE.

l.stage: The trumpets sound, and the KING enters with his nobles. GAUNT, BUSHY, BAGOT, GREEN, and others. When they are set, enter MOWBRAY in arms, defendant, with a Herald.
The trumpets sound. Enter BOLINGBROKE, appellant, in armour, with a Herald.
Flourish. Exeunt King Richard and train,

div.head: Act 1, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter the KING, with BAGOT and GREEN all at one door; and the DUKE OF AUMERLE at another.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter JOHN OF GAUNT sick, with the DUKE OF YORK, c.

l.stage: Enter KING RICHARD and QUEEN, AUMERLE, BUSHY, GREEN, BAGOT, ROSS, and WIL LOUGHBY.
Exit, borne off by his Attendants.
Flourish. Exeunt King, Queen, Aumerle, Bushy, Green, and Bagot.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter BOLINGBROKE and NORTHUMBERLAND, with Forces.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter SALISBURY and a Welsh Captain.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter BOLINGBROKE, YORK, NORTHUMBERLAND, ROSS, PERCY, WILLOUGHBY, with BUSHY and GREEN, prisoners.

l.stage: Exeunt Northumberland and others, with the prisoners.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
Enter KING RICHARD and BISHOP OF CARLISLE, AUMERLE, and Soldiers.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter, with drum and colours, BOLINGBROKE, YORK, NORTHUMBERLAND, Attendants, and forces.

l.stage: Parle without, and answer within. Then a flourish.
Enter on the walls, KING RICHARD, the BISHOP OF CARLISLE, AUMERLE, SCROOP, and SALISBURY.
Enter KING RICHARD and his attendant below.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 4
div.stage: Langley. The DUKE OF YORK's Garden.
Enter the QUEEN and two LADIES.

l.stage: Enter a Gardener, and two Servants.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter, as to the Parliament, BOLINGBROKE, AUMERLE, NORTHUMBERLAND, PERCY, FITZWATER, SURREY, the BISHOP OF CARLISLE, the ABBOT OF WESTMINSTER, and another Lord, Herald, Officers, and BAGOT.

l.stage: Re-enter YORK, with RICHARD, and Officers bearing the regalia.
Dashes the glass against the ground.
Exeunt King Richard, some Lords, and a Guard.
Exeunt all except the Bishop of Carlisle, the Abbot of Westminsler and Aumerle.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: London. A street leading to the Tower.

l.stage: He plucks it out of his bosom and reads it.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter BOLINGBROKE, PERCY, and other Lords.

l.stage: Enter a Groom of the Stable.
Snatching an axe from a Servant and killing him.
He kills another. Then Exton strikes him down.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 6
div.stage: Flourish. Enter BOLINGBROKE, YORK, with other Lords, and Attendants.

l.stage: Enter PERCY, and the BISHOP OF CARLISLE.
Enter EXTON, with persons bearing a coffin.
